Title: The Hobbit
Summary:
Bilbo Baggins is whisked from his quiet life by a band of dwarves and the wizard Gandalf. On a quest to reclaim a lost kingdom, he faces trolls, goblins, spiders, and a dragon. Along the road he discovers courage he never knew he had.
Themes: friendship; adventure; courage; homecoming

Winston Smith struggles for truth and individuality under a totalitarian regime that rewrites reality. His secret love affair becomes an act of rebellion. Surveillance and propaganda close in as he searches for freedom of thought.
Themes: oppression; surveillance; truth vs. lies; individuality

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Summary:
Young Scout Finch observes her father defend a Black man falsely accused in a segregated Southern town. Through childhood adventures and courtroom drama, she confronts injustice. Compassion becomes her compass in a divided community.
Themes: justice; empathy; racism; moral growth

Title: Dune
Summary:
Paul Atreides is thrust into a desert world where politics, prophecy, and ecology collide. As rival houses fight for control of spice, he learns the ways of the Fremen. Destiny reshapes him—and the future of the empire.
Themes: power; ecology; destiny; religion; survival

Title: The Name of the Wind
Summary:
Kvothe recounts his life—from orphaned street urchin to gifted student at a school of magic. He hunts for the truth behind a legendary tragedy. Music, wit, and obsession guide his rise and missteps.
Themes: storytelling; identity; knowledge; ambition

Title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Summary:
Journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander investigate a decades-old disappearance. Their pursuit uncovers corporate corruption and buried violence. Two uncommon allies learn to trust each other.
Themes: justice; corruption; trauma; partnership

Title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
Summary:
A man revisits his childhood and a neighbor family with uncanny powers. Memory opens a door to ancient forces and quiet heroism. Wonder and fear mingle in a tale about what we keep and what we forget.
Themes: memory; innocence; sacrifice; the supernatural

Title: Neuromancer
Summary:
Washed-up hacker Case is hired for one last job in a neon-soaked future. He dives through cyberspace with a volatile partner and an AI with its own agenda. Reality blurs as he races against corporate and digital ghosts.
Themes: technology; consciousness; freedom; alienation

Title: The Night Circus
Summary:
Two young magicians are bound to a duel staged within a mysterious, midnight circus. As love blooms, the game’s rules turn dangerous. The performers’ fates entwine beneath tents of wonder and shadow.
Themes: love; rivalry; destiny; imagination

Title: The Overstory
Summary:
Strangers’ lives intersect through their ties to trees and forests. Their choices ripple across decades, confronting exploitation and awe. The natural world becomes both character and cause.
Themes: nature; interconnectedness; activism; survival

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Summary: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, manners, and social standing in Regency England. Her wit and independence clash with Mr. Darcy's pride, leading to misunderstandings before love blossoms.

Title: Moby-Dick
Summary: Captain Ahab obsessively hunts the white whale that maimed him. Ishmael narrates a voyage across vast oceans, filled with philosophy, danger, and obsession with nature’s mysteries.

Title: The Great Gatsby
Summary: Jay Gatsby pursues wealth and glamour to win back Daisy Buchanan. Amid roaring twenties excess, Nick Carraway observes dreams corrode under greed and illusion.
Themes: love; wealth; illusion; the American Dream; loss

Title: Jane Eyre
Summary: Orphaned Jane becomes a governess at Thornfield Hall, where she meets the brooding Mr. Rochester. Secrets and trials test her resolve, but she insists on dignity and independence.

Title: Brave New World
Summary: In a future society engineered for stability, individuality is suppressed by pleasure and conformity. John, the 'Savage,' confronts a world where freedom is sacrificed for comfort.

Title: Frankenstein
Summary: Victor Frankenstein creates life, but recoils at his monstrous creation. The creature seeks acceptance but finds only rejection, leading to vengeance.

Title: Dracula
Summary: Jonathan Harker encounters the enigmatic Count Dracula. As Dracula spreads his dark influence, a group of allies battles to stop him.

Title: Les Misérables
Summary: Jean Valjean seeks redemption while Inspector Javert relentlessly pursues him. Love, sacrifice, and revolution sweep through 19th-century France.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Summary: Raskolnikov commits murder, believing himself above morality. Guilt and redemption unravel him as he faces the consequences of conscience.

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Summary: The Karamazov family spirals into conflict over faith, morality, and patricide. Philosophical debates blend with family drama.

Title: War and Peace
Summary: Amid Napoleonic wars, Russian aristocrats grapple with love, destiny, and history’s tide. Pierre and Natasha’s journeys intertwine with battles and ideals.

Title: Anna Karenina
Summary: Trapped in a loveless marriage, Anna falls for Count Vronsky. Her affair sparks scandal and tragedy in Russian high society.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Summary: Catherine and Heathcliff’s love is fierce, destructive, and transcendent. Generational conflict and revenge echo across the moors.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Summary: Holden Caulfield wanders New York, disillusioned with adult hypocrisy and yearning for innocence. His voice captures adolescent angst.

Title: The Lord of the Rings
Summary: Frodo Baggins carries the One Ring to Mordor to destroy it. Alongside friends and allies, he battles darkness and temptation.
Themes: friendship; courage; destiny; good vs. evil

Title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone
Summary: Harry discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts. With friends Ron and Hermione, he faces magical trials and the shadow of Voldemort.

Title: The Fellowship of the Ring
Summary: The first volume of Tolkien’s epic. Frodo begins his perilous journey to destroy the One Ring, aided by companions of diverse origins.

Title: Great Expectations
Summary: Pip’s journey from orphan to gentleman is shaped by mysterious benefactors, love, and social class.

Title: Don Quixote
Summary: An aging nobleman imagines himself a knight-errant. With Sancho Panza, he tilts at windmills and redefines heroism.

Title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
Summary: Dorian remains young while his portrait bears the scars of sin and age. Vanity and moral decay unravel him.

Title: Madame Bovary
Summary: Emma Bovary seeks romance beyond her provincial life. Her affairs and debts spiral toward tragedy.

Title: The Count of Monte Cristo
Summary: Edmond Dantès is wrongfully imprisoned but escapes to seek revenge with cunning and fortune.

Title: Fahrenheit 451
Summary: In a world where books are banned, Guy Montag questions conformity and seeks truth through forbidden knowledge.

Title: The Martian
Summary: Astronaut Mark Watney is stranded on Mars. With ingenuity and humor, he fights to survive until rescue.

Title: Foundation
Summary: Hari Seldon predicts the fall of the Galactic Empire. His plan to preserve knowledge spans centuries of intrigue.

Title: Snow Crash
Summary: In a hyper-commercialized future, Hiro Protagonist battles a virtual drug threatening minds and society.

Title: Ender’s Game
Summary: Child prodigy Ender Wiggin trains in a battle school to fight alien invaders, grappling with leadership and morality.

Title: A Game of Thrones
Summary: Noble families vie for power in Westeros, where politics, prophecy, and betrayal shape kingdoms and destinies.

Title: The Road
Summary: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic wasteland, clinging to love and survival.

Title: The Kite Runner
Summary: Amir seeks redemption for betraying his childhood friend in war-torn Afghanistan.

Title: Life of Pi
Summary: Stranded at sea with a Bengal tiger, Pi Patel battles survival and faith.

Title: The Book Thief
Summary: In Nazi Germany, Liesel finds solace in stolen books while Death narrates her story of love and loss.

Title: The Hunger Games
Summary: Katniss Everdeen volunteers for a deadly televised survival game, igniting rebellion.

Title: Divergent
Summary: Tris Prior discovers she doesn’t fit into her society’s factions. Her divergence marks her as dangerous.

Title: Oliver Twist
Summary: An orphan navigates poverty, crime, and kindness in Dickens’ tale of Victorian London.

Title: David Copperfield
Summary: David recounts his growth from childhood hardship to success as a writer.

Title: The Scarlet Letter
Summary: Hester Prynne endures shame and ostracism for bearing a child out of wedlock in Puritan New England.

Title: Uncle Tom’s Cabin
Summary: Harriet Beecher Stowe’s anti-slavery novel depicts cruelty and humanity amidst oppression.

Title: Gone with the Wind
Summary: Scarlett O’Hara survives war and upheaval in the American South with resilience and desire.

Title: The Left Hand of Darkness
Summary: Genly Ai visits a planet with ambisexual inhabitants, confronting culture, gender, and trust.

Title: Hyperion
Summary: Pilgrims tell interconnected tales while journeying to confront the Shrike, a mysterious entity.

Title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
Summary: Rick Deckard hunts rogue androids in a post-apocalyptic world, questioning humanity itself.

Title: The Time Machine
Summary: A traveler journeys to the far future, witnessing humanity’s evolution and decline.

Title: 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea
Summary: Captain Nemo guides the Nautilus beneath the oceans, exploring wonders and mysteries.

Title: The Silmarillion
Summary: Tolkien’s mythic history of Middle-earth recounts creation, heroes, and the struggle of light and dark.
Themes: myth; creation; destiny; good vs. evil

Title: Mistborn: The Final Empire
Summary: Vin discovers her power among rebels fighting a thousand-year-old tyrant.

Title: Elantris
Summary: A cursed city hides fallen gods. One princess uncovers secrets of faith and survival.

Title: The Way of Kings
Summary: In Roshar, storms shape culture and destiny. Kaladin, Shallan, and Dalinar confront power and prophecy.

Title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
Summary: Children enter Narnia through a wardrobe, joining Aslan against the White Witch.
Themes: faith; courage; good vs. evil; sacrifice

Title: The Alchemist
Summary: Santiago journeys to find treasure, discovering wisdom and destiny along the way.

Title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
Summary: Two Afghan women’s lives intertwine under oppression and war, forging resilience and love.

Title: American Gods
Summary: Shadow Moon enters a battle between old gods and new in modern America.

Title: Never Let Me Go
Summary: Children at a boarding school discover the haunting truth of their existence.

Title: The Shadow of the Wind
Summary: A boy in post-war Barcelona discovers a mysterious book that changes his life.

Title: Cloud Atlas
Summary: Interconnected stories across centuries reveal humanity’s struggles and rebirths.

Title: The Girl on the Train
Summary: A troubled woman becomes entangled in a missing persons case through obsession.

Title: Gone Girl
Summary: A husband becomes the suspect when his wife disappears, secrets unraveling.

Title: The Da Vinci Code
Summary: A symbologist races through Europe unraveling codes tied to ancient mysteries.

Title: Angels & Demons
Summary: Robert Langdon confronts a secret society threatening Vatican City.

Title: Beloved
Summary: Set after the American Civil War, a woman is haunted by the ghost of her dead child and the trauma of slavery.

Title: Their Eyes Were Watching God
Summary: Janie Crawford recounts her search for identity and love through three marriages in the early 20th-century South.

Title: Things Fall Apart
Summary: Okonkwo struggles to uphold tradition as colonial forces disrupt Igbo society.

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Summary: The Buendía family saga unfolds in the magical town of Macondo, blending myth and reality.

Title: Love in the Time of Cholera
Summary: Florentino waits decades to reunite with Fermina in a meditation on love and time.

Title: The Handmaid’s Tale
Summary: Offred narrates life under a theocratic regime where women are oppressed and reduced to roles.

Title: Oryx and Crake
Summary: In a dystopian future, genetic engineering reshapes humanity and nature in catastrophic ways.

Title: The Testaments
Summary: Sequel to The Handmaid’s Tale, offering perspectives from within and outside Gilead.

Title: White Teeth
Summary: Intergenerational immigrant families in London grapple with identity, history, and belonging.

Title: Midnight’s Children
Summary: Born at the stroke of India’s independence, Saleem Sinai’s life mirrors the nation’s turbulent history.

Title: The Last Wish
Summary: A collection of interwoven stories following Geralt of Rivia, a monster hunter navigating morality, magic, and destiny in a dark fantasy world.

Title: The Old Man and the Sea
Summary: An aging fisherman battles a giant marlin, testing his endurance and spirit.

Title: Of Mice and Men
Summary: Two migrant workers chase dreams of stability during the Great Depression, but fate intervenes.

Title: The Grapes of Wrath
Summary: The Joad family migrates west during the Dust Bowl, facing injustice and resilience.

Title: A Tale of Two Cities
Summary: Set during the French Revolution, love and sacrifice play out amidst chaos and vengeance.

Title: Heart of Darkness
Summary: Marlow journeys into the Congo, uncovering the darkness of colonialism and human nature.

Title: Brave New World Revisited
Summary: A non-fiction follow-up where Huxley reflects on his dystopian vision and its growing relevance.

Title: The Moon is a Harsh Mistress
Summary: Colonists on the Moon rebel against Earth’s rule with the help of a self-aware computer.

Title: Childhood’s End
Summary: Humanity evolves under the guidance of mysterious alien Overlords, facing transcendence.

Title: Contact
Summary: A scientist discovers extraterrestrial signals, sparking a journey across science and faith.

Title: The Andromeda Strain
Summary: Scientists race to contain a deadly extraterrestrial microorganism threatening Earth.

Title: The Once and Future King
Summary: A retelling of Arthurian legend, exploring kingship, love, and destiny.

Title: Jonathan Strange & Mr Norrell
Summary: Two magicians revive English magic during the Napoleonic Wars, with rivalry and mystery.

Title: Good Omens
Summary: An angel and demon team up to prevent the apocalypse with humor and heart.

Title: Eragon
Summary: A farm boy discovers a dragon egg, beginning a quest of magic, destiny, and rebellion.

Title: The Golden Compass
Summary: Lyra journeys across parallel worlds, battling power and seeking truth.

Title: The Lovely Bones
Summary: A murdered girl narrates from the afterlife, watching her family cope with grief and justice.

Title: The Secret Life of Bees
Summary: In the 1960s South, a girl finds solace and truth with three beekeeping sisters.

Title: The Help
Summary: In 1960s Mississippi, Black maids and white women confront prejudice and courage through secret writing.

Title: Room
Summary: A boy raised in captivity with his mother discovers the outside world for the first time.

Title: The Goldfinch
Summary: After a tragedy, a boy clings to a stolen painting as he navigates loss, art, and identity.
